metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5436 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.7.12 and earlier allows remoteadministrators to affect availability via vectors related to Server:InnoDB.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5436` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.13-0ubuntu4').
